ratings.comment: Dr. Lea is an amazing professor. Her teaching style, compassion and ability to explain well complex processes allowed me to understand and enjoy the material covered in lectures. This is a challenging course but I thoroughly enjoyed coming to lectures.

Slideshow presentations did not always match lecture course notes, but she always clarified when stuff should be added or if it was necessary to know. I found her to be  a very funny, compassionate, and  knowledgeable professor. Offers a tremendous amount of outside help to those who need it. Exams were fair. I would take a course with her again!

Worst lecturer I've ever seen. Lectures are highly disorganized, with myriad redundant slides soaking up time recovering basic concepts while not leaving enough time to adequately explain the more complex details that will actually be tested. The text is necessary to figure out what she was trying (and failing) to teach us.
I am now sure that she is the best teacher I had. Somehow I did not feel comfortable learning from her.

Awesome professor! Her exams are harder than the second professor's, but she is still an awesome teacher. Go to lecture and you will learn what you need to know for the exams. If you need to take phys, take it the semester she teaches it!
So smart, funny, hard, but helpful. Teaches a great class!

Do not need to use the book with her teaching. Notes include almost everything you need to know- just go to lecture and you are set. Great sense of humor.  Material would be crystal clear if she didn't have an accent, but understanding her isn't too difficult most of the time.

She is hilarious and an incredible physiology prof.  She writes all of her notes for you in a packet so you don't need to use the book. You just need to understand what she tells you.  She is also very helpful outside of class and one of the nicest profs I've met with.
Amazing Professor! Most helpful outside of class I've ever had! Worth it 100% to go to her office hours. If you have to take physiology 335, Take it with Dr. Lea!

The most helpful professor outside of class that I've ever had. Took an entire Sunday to sit and write students email responses to questions before an exam. Has an accent, but it's not too difficult to understand. Overall, a very good professor.
